awd_abstract_narration: The primary purpose for this High                                               Performance Liquid Chromatography                                               (HPLC) system is an investigation                                               of the stability of monoclonal                                                  antibody (MAb) production by                                                    hybridomas and quadromas, the                                                   fusion product of two hybridomas,                                               during long-term continuous culture                                             in suspension and immobilized                                                   systems.  Using an optimized HPLC                                               process, the number and                                                         concentrations of antibodies for                                                both parent hybridomas, and the                                                 quadroma, will be monitored during                                              long-term continuous culture.                                                   Results will be integrated with                                                 concurrent flow cytometry and                                                   metabolic studies in an effort to                                               elucidate mechanisms for improving                                              the stability of MAb production by                                              hybridomas and quadromas.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: Dartmouth College Thayer School of Engineering
